source.title: Getting started with Vercel
source.description: Vercel onboarding: account creation, email/Git authentication, signup, login, framework support, preview environments, production deployments, `npm i -g vercel` CLI installation, dashboard navigation.

source.title: Getting Started | Step 1 of 8 - Projects and deployments
source.description: Projects vs deployments concepts: projects contain multiple deployments, deployments triggered by Git commits, imports, or `vercel deploy` CLI, auto-generated URLs, monorepo support, project dashboard.

source.title: Getting Started | Step 2 of 8 - Use a template
source.description: Template deployment workflow: browse `/templates`, connect Git provider (GitHub/GitLab/Bitbucket), auto-clone repository, configure environment variables, `vercel.json` settings, `vercel --cwd` CLI deployment.

source.title: Getting Started | Step 3 of 8 - Import an existing project
source.description: Import existing Git repository: connect GitHub/GitLab/Bitbucket, framework auto-detection, configure build command, output directory, install command, environment variables, `vercel.json`, `vercel --cwd` CLI.

source.title: Getting Started | Step 4 of 8 - Add a domain
source.description: Custom domain configuration: apex domains (`acme.com`), subdomains (`blog.acme.com`), wildcard domains (`*.acme.com`), purchasing new domains, pointing existing domains to Vercel, domain transfers.

source.title: Getting Started | Step 5 of 8 - Buy a domain
source.description: Purchasing domains via `vercel domains buy`, marketplace search, TLD selection, premium pricing, cart checkout, payment details, ICANN registrant verification, WHOIS privacy, auto-renewal, project domain configuration.

source.title: Getting Started | Step 6 of 8 - Use an existing domain
source.description: Adding existing domains via `vercel domains add`, project domain settings, apex domains with A records, subdomains with CNAME records, TXT domain verification, nameserver configuration, wildcard domain setup, `www` redirect options.

source.title: Getting Started | Step 7 of 8 - Collaborate on Vercel
source.description: Git-connected automatic deployments, production vs preview environments, `main` branch production builds, pull request previews, deployment URLs, Comments toolbar for team feedback, preview sharing with collaborators.

source.title: Getting Started | Step 8 of 8 - Next Steps
source.description: Post-setup feature overview: Functions for serverless infrastructure, Vercel Blob and Edge Config storage, Monitoring/Web Analytics/Speed Insights observability, HTTPS and DDoS mitigation security features.

source.title: Using the REST API - Vercel API Docs
source.description: REST API fundamentals: `https://api.vercel.com` base URL, HTTP/2 and TLS 1.3, JSON content-type, bearer token authentication, `teamId` query parameter, data types, `until`/`limit` pagination, `X-RateLimit-*` headers, endpoint versioning.

source.title: Integrations - Vercel API Docs
source.description: Vercel SDK `@vercel/sdk` integration listing example: `getConfigurations` method with `view: 'account'`, accessing `slug`, `installationType`, `projects` properties, bearer token authentication pattern.

source.title: Vercel Hobby Plan
source.description: Hobby plan free tier limits: Edge Config reads/writes, CPU-hrs, GB-hrs memory, function invocations/duration, image optimisation, Speed Insights, Web Analytics. 30-day reset cycle, non-commercial use only, Pro comparison table.

source.title: AI SDK
source.description: AI SDK Core TypeScript toolkit: `generateText` for LLM text, `generateObject`/`streamObject` for structured JSON with Zod schemas, `tool` function for external integrations, provider abstraction (OpenAI, Anthropic), Next.js/Vue/Svelte/Node.js support.

source.title: Vercel Pro Plan
source.description: Legacy Pro plan pricing: $20/month per seat, team collaboration, RBAC roles (Owner, Member, Billing), monthly resource-based billing, downgrade to Hobby process, Store/Domain transfer requirements before downgrade.

source.title: Spend Management
source.description: Pro plan spend controls: spend amount per billing cycle, alert thresholds (50%/75%/100%), notification types (web, email, SMS), webhook payloads with `budgetAmount`/`currentSpend`/`thresholdPercent`, project pausing/unpausing, `endOfBillingCycle` events.

source.title: Deploying to Vercel
source.description: Deployment methods: Git (GitHub, GitLab, Bitbucket, Azure DevOps), `vercel --prod` CLI, Deploy Hooks HTTP triggers, REST API with SHA file uploads. Dashboard for redeploying, promoting to production, viewing resources.

source.title: Environments
source.description: Three default environments: Local, Preview, Production. CLI commands `vercel link`, `vercel env pull`, `vercel --prod`, `vercel deploy --target=staging`. Custom environments for Pro/Enterprise with branch tracking and domain attachment.

source.title: How to Build a Fullstack App with Next.js, Prisma, and Postgres
source.description: Fullstack tutorial: Next.js Pages Router, Prisma ORM with `schema.prisma`, Vercel Postgres, NextAuth.js GitHub OAuth, `@prisma/client`, `prisma db push`, `getStaticProps`/`getServerSideProps`, CRUD API routes, deployment to Vercel.

source.title: How do I generate a “sitemap.xml” for my Next.js app on Vercel?
source.description: Next.js App Router sitemap generation using `sitemap.ts` file convention, `MetadataRoute.Sitemap` type, URL array with `lastModified`, `changeFrequency`, `priority` fields, build-time XML output.

source.title: How can I run end-to-end tests after my Vercel Preview Deployment?
source.description: E2E testing after Vercel preview deployments: GitHub Actions `repository_dispatch` event triggers, `deployment.succeeded` webhooks, Playwright workflow configuration, Deployment Protection bypass for automation.

source.title: Next.js on Vercel
source.description: Next.js on Vercel: ISR with `revalidate`, SSR via Vercel Functions, `loading`/`Suspense` streaming, `next/image` optimization, `next/font`, OG image generation, Middleware, Draft Mode, `@vercel/analytics`, `@vercel/speed-insights`, service integrations.

source.title: Production checklist for launch
source.description: Production launch checklist: incident response, rollback strategies, CSP headers, WAF configuration, Deployment Protection, Log Drains, caching headers, ISR tuning, Speed Insights, Image Optimization, Fluid compute, Spend Management alerts.

source.title: Getting started with Speed Insights
source.description: Speed Insights quickstart: enabling in dashboard, installing `@vercel/speed-insights`, adding `SpeedInsights` component to Next.js App Router `layout.tsx`, `vercel deploy`, viewing Core Web Vitals metrics in dashboard.

source.title: Speed Insights Configuration with @vercel/speed-insights
source.description: `@vercel/speed-insights` configuration: `sampleRate` for event sampling percentage, `beforeSend` callback for filtering/redacting data, `debug` mode, `route` for dynamic path aggregation, `endpoint` for multi-project domains, `scriptSrc` URL override.

source.title: Speed Insights Metrics
source.description: Speed Insights metrics: LCP, CLS, INP, FCP, FID, TBT, TTFB target values, Real Experience Score (RES) weighted calculation, P75/P90/P95/P99 percentiles, Virtual Experience Score (VES), score colour ranges, Lighthouse 10 criteria.

source.title: Getting started with Vercel Web Analytics
source.description: Vercel Web Analytics quickstart: enable in dashboard, install `@vercel/analytics` package, add `<Analytics />` component to root layout, `vercel deploy`, verify `/_vercel/insights/view` requests.

source.title: Advanced Web Analytics Config with @vercel/analytics
source.description: `@vercel/analytics` configuration: `mode` prop for environment detection, `debug` logging, `beforeSend` hook with `BeforeSendEvent` for filtering/redaction, `endpoint` for multi-project domains, `scriptSrc` for custom script URLs.

source.title: Tracking custom events
source.description: Custom event tracking with `track()` function: client-side import from `@vercel/analytics`, server-side from `@vercel/analytics/server`, custom data properties, 255-character limits, dashboard Events panel.

source.title: Filtering Analytics
source.description: Web Analytics filtering by routes, pages, hostname, referrers, UTM parameters, country, browsers, devices, OS. Drill-downs for Referrers, Flags, Custom Events panels. Twitter/t.co resolver for link origin tracking.

source.title: Protection Bypass for Automation
source.description: E2E testing automation bypass with `x-vercel-protection-bypass` header, `VERCEL_AUTOMATION_BYPASS_SECRET` environment variable, `x-vercel-set-bypass-cookie` for follow-up requests, `samesitenone` SameSite configuration for iframes, Playwright config example.

source.title: Deployment Protection on Vercel
source.description: Deployment Protection configuration: Standard Protection, All Deployments, production-only protection, legacy options. Protection methods: Vercel Authentication, Password Protection, Trusted IPs. `VERCEL_URL` migration patterns, Advanced Deployment Protection add-on.

source.title: Vercel Authentication
source.description: Vercel Authentication restricting deployment access to team members, project members, access groups. Access request workflow, approval/revocation via dashboard and API, `ssoProtection` API field, `vercel_authentication` Terraform configuration, security token scope.

source.title: Deploying GitHub Projects with Vercel
source.description: GitHub integration: automatic deployments, preview URLs, fork protection, production rollbacks, silencing bot comments. GitHub Actions with `vercel build`/`vercel deploy --prebuilt`, `repository_dispatch` events, `VERCEL_GIT_*` environment variables, repository permission scopes.
